ch.unibas.informatik.hs15.cs203.datarepository.api

Class Criteria

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.unibas.informatik.hs15.cs203.datarepository.api.Criteria

  • public final class Criteria
extends Object
    Criteria to specify a set of data sets. A data set fulfills the criteria if the following criteria are fulfilled if specified (i.e. not null ):
    • Data set identifier is as the specified id.
    • Data set name is as the specified name.
    • Data set name or description contains the specified text.
    • Data set time stamp is after the specified after.
    • Data set time stamp is before the specified before.
    Remarks:
    • All specified criteria have to be fulfilled.
    • If non of the attributes are specified the set contains all data sets.
    • If id is specified all other attributes have to be null.
    Author:
    Franz-Josef Elmer

    • Constructor Detail

      • Criteria

        public Criteria(String nameOrNull,
                String textOrNull,
                Date afterOrNull,
                Date beforeOrNull)
        Creates an instance for specified four criteria. A criterion can be null.
        Parameters:
        nameOrNull - Name data set has to match.
        textOrNull - Text snippet the name or description of a matching data set contains.
        afterOrNull - The time stamp of all matching data sets has to be after this time stamp.
        beforeOrNull - The time stamp of all matching data sets has to be before this time stamp.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either nameOrNull or textOrNull is an empty string.

    • Method Detail

      • all

        public static Criteria all()
        Returns a criteria which are matched by all data sets.

      • forId

        public static Criteria forId(String id)
        Returns a criteria which can only be matched by the data set with specified id.
        Parameters:
        id - A not-null nonempty string.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null or an empty string.

      • getId

        public String getId()
        Returns the id or null if not specified.

        Returns the name or null if not specified.
